comments:
Build 20020123

- launched eclipse-in-eclipse in debug mode (auto switch to debug perspective)
- it hit a breakpoint
- I double-cliked on the breakpoint in the editor to remove it.
- internal error

Can you still reproduce this problem? I could not in build 2002-01-24.

Did the debug perspective open in a new window or not? In a new page or not? 
What are the settings for opening new perspectives in the preference dialog?

The interesting thing is that showView on WorkbenchPage is only one line long. 
The only thing that would cause a NPE is if the page's perspective was null - a 
case that is not supposed to happen...unless some half disposed page is lying 
around your workbench?

I have not been able to reproduce it.  My options are:

- Open new perspective in the same window
- Reuse perspectives with the same input
- Open new views as fast views
- Show debug perspective when program is launched in debug mode

It might also be interesting that I have three "old style" workbench pages in 
one workbench window: team, java, and debug.  Other errors had occurred that 
same afternoon that might be related:

- http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=8483
- http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=8491

It is possible for the active perspective to be null in rare occasions (like 
when loading and active perspective fails to load properly).

All reference to active perspective have been updated to check for null if 
applicable.

Fix in build > 2002-01-30
